snippet: The book that spans Mrs. Gandhi’s life — from her birth in a small town to her ascent as the Congress Party matriarch — was released without fanfare in India.
abstract: Indian publisher Roli Books quietly releases Javier Moro book The Red Sari, about life of Sonia Gandhi, once considered by her followers to be de facto prime minister of India; book's depiction of Gandhi was widely protested in India while she was in power, but election of Prime Min Narendra Modi has led to changed political climate that has made publication possible.
lead_paragraph: The book that spans Mrs. Gandhi’s life — from her birth in a small town to her ascent as the Congress Party matriarch — was released without fanfare in India.

headline.seo: ‘The Red Sari,’ on Sonia Gandhi, Is Released in India
headline.main: Once Incendiary, a Book Debuts Quietly in a Reshaped Nation
headline.print_headline: Book on Sonia Gandhi, Once Incendiary, Debuts Quietly in a Reshaped India
